text: We see an aerial shot of Boston. The sound of WAAB-FM bur over the top. We hear about local events, rock concerts, films. We see a red 75’ Chevy Van stuck in traffic. Title: May 13 1978. Boston.

A blue 72 Plymouth Fury is parked up by a battered lookin warehouse. There are three people inside. A woman and a m in the front, a man in the back. INT. PLYMOUTH DAY. In the drivers seat: Justine. 28. Big polarized Sunglasse Suit. Small build, blonde hair. By her side: Frank. 50. Leather jacket. Smoking. Slacks. Dark hair flecked with g Stocky. In the back seat: Chris. 35. Green combat Jacket. Raybans. Dark hair. Slim. Frank looks straight ahead angrily. When he speaks it’s i Belfast accent.
Where is he? Justine speaks; flat American with a tinge of something European.
It’s okay Frank. We have ten minutes yet. Frank shakes his head and looks at his watch. Chris shrug He speaks with a Dublin accent.
These things happen, probably traffic. Frank sniffs. This is on him. He brought the late guy int this.
Fuck it. I hate this shit.
Stop fretting... it’s fine. Justine smiles listening to the conversation.
What?
How long have you two been married?
Long time... The sex has stopped. We just argue now.
You flatter yourself. I wouldn’t go gay for you...
Who then?
No one... I don’t want to talk about that kind of thing.
You started it... Chris enjoys needling Frank.
I knew his Father Here it comes.
I promised i'd keep him out of trouble.
Well you pretty much fucked that up.
Ah well, life can get in the way of promises sometimes. Justine smiles. She knows.
Justine? Justine is looking out the window, lost in her own though After a beat she turns.
Yes.
Where are you from darling?
Originally?
Yes, I can hear something in that accent.
It’s Swedish.
Swedish? I was going to say German.
She’s not a German. You have cloth ears Frank
German. Looks she’s smiling. Justine smiles to herself.
Laughing... at you.
When I say German... She smiles. It’s the memory of the old country... the Motherland... Germany, Germany, Germany...
I spent six weeks in Stockholm in 72 remember.
That thing... Fuck. How could I forget that. Frank shakes his head remembering.
I'm Swedish Chris smiles.
You see.
Don’t overplay your hand.
I'd like to go back to Stockholm.
Well that can happen soon enough. We just have to sort this bit of business out.
Then back we go
Back to Ireland?
Yeah. Frank looks out of the window and pulls a filter-less Cam from its pack.
Do you like this place?
Boston?
America. There’s a pause. It’s as if she’s never considered it.
Sure. She isn’t giving anything away from behind her sunglasses Frank smiles and lights up. He wants to go home. He watch stray dog nosing around in some rubbish.

Inside, Stevo, 28. Long hair, wide ‘Apocalypse Now’ moustache. T-shirt jacket and jeans. He has a black eye. talks in a Boston accent. Bernie is his heavy lidded side kick. Bernie is driving, Stevo is holding his head in his hands
My fucking head.
I told you not to mix your drinks...
I feel like my brain is trying to crawl out of my eyes.
Every time... I tell you
Have you got any headache pills? Pause. Bernie looks sideways at Stevo.
No. I’ve got some smack though. Bernie shrugs apologetically. A sledgehammer to crack a n
I didn’t think you were doing that shit anymore. Stevo is mock worried.
Just at the weekends. It’s for unwinding. I’ve got a very stressful life. Stevo sits there for five seconds. His head pounding like bass drum.
Okay maybe a little. Bernie smirks and hands Stevo a small wrap of heroin.
When will we finish today? Stevo carefully opens the wrap.
Careful.
Hour and a half tops. They do the deal and we help load up the crates.
And there’s guns in the crates?
Yes guns... You don’t get paid $100 for moving cans of beans.
I can’t get in any trouble Stevo... I...
You should have thought about that before you punched that guy in Harlequins last night.
I was provoked.
Look in my eyes.
I hate it when you do that... It means you are bullshitting me.
Look in my eyes... Bernie pushes Stevo away.
I am driving... Stevo decants a little of the Heroin into a burnt bit of foil.
I love you man. I would never let anything happen to you. Stevo lights up his zippo under the tin foil.
HA HA Now you have totally fucking cursed me.

Dont worry man.. SNIFFFF... What can go wrong? He passes back the wrap. Bernie smiles and Stevo drifts on a warm cloud of morphia EXT. STREET. The van pulls up behind the Plymouth. Stevo gets out. Fra has already got out to meet him. He walks over to the man drags him back to the van. We cut in close now and see:
Where have the fuck have you been?
I’m sorry Frank.
If you say traffic I’m going to punch you in the throat. Stevo looks at Frank.
There was a density of cars that slowed my egress. Frank pauses.
Are you on drugs?
No. Frank starts again...
Don’t lie to me you little fuck. Are you high?
No sir. INT. CAR DAY. Chris sees that Justine is watching Frank talking to the boys.
He’s just a bit on edge.
..-and he’s meant to be looking after you?
Sure... Do you think that’s the dynamic? I’m meant to be making sure he doesn’t get into trouble. I'm a calming influence. We hear a bump as Frank slams Stevo up against the van.
Frank knocks on the van window. It winds down. Bernie pee out.
Hey Bernard
Hey Frank.
Is he on drugs? Bernie thinks for a moment. His face a mask of control.
Hey. I am no rat. But he has taken some medication for a migrane. Frank turns to Stevo and steps up close. He looks him in eyes.
I know you don’t really understand how serious I am. What..
I do Frank...
.--I am talking... What my capacity to hold a grudge is...because nothing bad has happened to you has it?
No. Stevo is agreeing to agree here. Though he does it poorly Frank reads him.
Your Grandmother dieing of cancer aged 95 does not count.
You don’t know anything about me.
Is that supposed to reassure me?
Well...
You are made of glass to me Steven. Frank grabs Stevo by the balls. His fist crushing them through the denim.
Does that focus your mind?
Fuuuuck.
I’m holding your brain in my hand now ain’t I? You ever going to be late for me again?
No. Frank looks round and sees Bernie watching him
Bernard. If you want some, just say. I’1l open you up like a tin of beans. Bernie mulls this for a nano-second.
You are good Frank.
I promised my sister that I'd bring you home in one piece. You are not going to make a cunt of me are you?
No.. Frank lets go of Stevo’s balls and he staggers back. Fran manner has changed. He is matter of fact.
Why have you got a black eye?
Walked into a door? Frank doesn't move. Stevo becomes uncomfortable
What are you doing? Stop that. Frank stares into his soul. INT. PLYMOUTH DAY.
You ever wonder where the guns go?
No
You are not curious?
What are you doing? Trying to rub my nose in it?
I just wonder what you are doing here
Because of what? Because I’m a woman?  10.
A good looking woman Justine smiles
Oh I see... okay
What you laughing about?
Does it ever work?
What?
This. The humiliation routine.
I don’t follow.
You're going to tell me all about the horrors of your life, while trying to get into my underwear. That kind of thing. Chris thinks
Yeah - I usually lead with the horrors, then the looking haunted then a bit of eye contact..
And this works?
Sure
Show me your haunted. Chris does haunted
That’s more retarded.
What are you doing later?
Picking up my kid. Cooking dinner. Not hanging out with terrorists.  11.
I’m not a terrorist. Chris looks sad.
Sorry.. Stop ! That’s part of it... Chris drops the sad look and smiles. Justine lights a cigarette.
You dangerous are you? Mysterious international gun dealing lady.

Yup. Justine puffs on her cigarette. Frank gets into the car followed by Stevo. Chris looks at Stevo’s black eye. Frank looks at Stevo’s in the mirror. He purses his lips. Chris points at the bl eye using the minimum of effort.
Did you win?
I walked into a door. Chris smiles tightly... Stevo is a clown.
Where did you get him from Frank? Stevo reacts hurt. He shrugs..
Talk to me if you’re talking about me... Chris and Frank ignore Stevo.
My sisters husband. She’s got a bar.
You found him in a bar? Chris smiles. Stevo frowns.
Frankie...  12.
Don’t call me Frankie. I hate that. -pauses— Or Francis.
Frank...
This guy is an idiot.
It was short notice. Stevo rolls his eyes at the foreign language. He tries to talk to Justine
I’m Stevo. What’s your name?
Don’t talk to her.
Why not?
Do you know her?
No.
Are you married to my sister?
You are married?
Yeah Justine makes a face ‘thats a suprise’
Where is the van from?
I bought it like you said. Bernie got it.. It’s cool
Good. You did exactly what I said? Stevo is embarrassed by the questioning in front of Justi  13.
Come on Frank. I’m not totally stupid.
That’s up for debate.
You got any foundation with you Justine love?
Sure Justine pulls out a compact. Stevo works out what’s about be asked.
Oh Frank, fuckkk... Frank hands it over.
You put it on boy...
Jesus Frank.
Put it on or I'll give you one on the other side to match. Stevo sadly applies the powder to his eye. It helps a bit Frank looks at him. He softens.
Come here... He grabs the powder and applies the makeup.
I don’t know what she sees in you
I bet he is dynamite in the sack. Justine looks round. She looks at Chris and shakes her he ™o!
You can tell by looking?
It’s my super power. Chris watches Frank apply the make up to Stevo he shakes head. Stevo notices and pouts.  14.
Keep your fucking head still. Justine looks up and sees something.
Here he comes. We see a guy shambling out of the shadows. He moves towar the car. Good looking, longish hair as is the fashion. Su jacket. Blue jeans: His name is Ord. Frank slaps Stevo’s cheeks.
There you go. You look great. The man approaches he smiles broadly when he sees Justine stops by the Plymouth.
Hey Justine.
Hey Ord.
These your boyfriends?
Yeah.
Hey fellas... Frank is tight lipped. We see Ord as Frank sees him. Clea eyed (this is a tell for Frank of exercise and general dangerousness). He looks military.
Afternoon. You’re late.
I’m sorry. Traffic. Frank looks Ord in the eye for a moment.
I love your accent.
Do you?
Kerry?
Holywood.  15.
Hollywood? He smiles. Frank gets this reaction a lot. Holywood is between Belfast and Bangor in Ireland. Hollywood is in California.
The real fucking Holywood. Ords’ smile remains as he looks to the backseat.
And these guys?
You don’t need to know their names.
I do Frank. It’s polite. There’s a moment. Ords’ smile never leaves his lips. Chri looks over for the first time. He takes his sun glasses o He reveals cold eyes.
Chris. Ord turns to Stevo. He looks at the make up covered eye. registers something is a bit weird here.
Stevo - and that’s Bernie. Bernie waves from the van.
Okay. My names James Ordan. You can call me Ord. Okay.
Please to meet you ‘Ord’. Can we get on with this please?
Sure. Just a few guide-lines for you all.. This is obviously a tense situation. I am armed. Ord opens his jacket with a flourish to reveal a holster pistol. He gestures to it dramatically.
I am sure that you are too. Frank doesn't give anything away. Stevo grins embarrassed having his mind read. Maybe he is made of glass.  16.

I want to get home tonight. I've got shit to do. I appreciate you are very serious heavy freedom fighting mother fuckers. Fuck the Brits.. Free Ireland. I get that. That’s cool. This is home of ‘Fuck the Brits!’ Ord looks at Frank and Chris’s faces. They look on impassively at his attempts at levity Lets just take this calm. Did you all jack off before coming here? The moment hangs there for a split second
What was that?
Did you jack off? In the hotel. Ord makes the international gesture for masturbation.
What the fuck does it have to...?
I’m not working with any one who brought a loaded weapon. There is a moment of silence. Frank and Chris smirk.
I did. Justine smiles.

Christ Steven. There is a pause. Ord has doing his job well. The tension defused a little. They get out of the car. Bernie joins them from the van. They follow Ord towards the warehouse. Justine looks arou The buildings are abandoned and nailed shut. If you wante run, there would be no where to go. Chris is carrying a brief case. Ord looks at Stevo  17.
Why are you wearing makeup? Before Stevo can say ‘I walked into a door’ Frank interru
He has a birth mark. Ord doesn't buy this for a second.
O-kay. Chris glances around
Who owns this place?
A friend of a friend. There’s a security guy but he’s not here today. Taking a ‘religious’ holiday. This last bit is an obvious lie. Ord smirks at the idea o religious holiday.
What did they used to do here?

Make stuff. Not any more though... Titles roll over the walk. Music: Boston plays ‘More than a feeling’ Title: Free Fire. In yellow futura extra bold font. Title: Adapted from the novel ‘IRON SIGHT’ by Jerome Kari INT. WAREHOUSE CORRIDOR. The group walk inside along dark concrete corridors. Fran looks a little tense. He scans around expecting trouble. Ord is not bothered. He knows the situation. The rest of the titles play out here. Stars. Producers. Financiers. Writer.  18.

We see the group move through a broken down factory. Pige flap about disturbed. Title: Directed by Ben Wheatley A big wide as the group move through a large empty space. INT. WAREHOUSE CORRIDOR. They walk through a corridor. The door closes behind them clicks shut. Ord looks back at it for a split second. INT. WAREHOUSE CORRIDOR. They walk along another corridor and then enter out into another large space.

The warehouse has hefty concrete pillars dotted around it The ground is littered with broken bottles. Refuse sacks, piles of rubbish, bits of abandoned cars, broken foundati of offices and smashed machine tool plinths. The foundati are stubby walls marking out where the offices would have been in the factory. At their highest around two feet. Sometimes lower than a foot. Frank looks around scanning the space. We see far back from the group. A POV of another person behind a pillar watching them. The group move towards the middle of the warehouse. There a small fold out table.
Where are we going? Ord turns gesturing to the table.

We are here. Frank looks out to the shadows. Chris turns around and lo about. There is a staircase leading off to offices. Justi looks up. There are skylights. She looks out to the far pillar. She looks nervous.
Where are your friends?  19.
They can see you.
If there’s a problem, I guarantee you will be the first to go.
I told you Frank. I've got things to do tonight. Chris scans the area. It’s quiet. Justine looks to Ord.

Okay, let’s wrap this up Ord. Ord whistles. A metal shutter rolls up at the far end of warehouse. Two figures enter. Martin Kargo and Vernon Jeffries. Martin is thin and wiry. Vernon is thick set wi heavy moustache. Vernon is carrying a rifle bag. Their footsteps echo around the space. They approach.
Justine

Vernon Vernon unzips the bag and pulls out an AR18 automatic rif He puts it on the table. Frank watches him carefully. The AR18 looks like a standard machine gun. Same characterist as an M16. Black and dangerous looking.

AR18. Factory fresh. Vernon takes out the magazine and puts it on the table. H then pulls back the rack three times and presents it to F so he can see that there are no rounds in the weapon. All this time he has been pointing the weapon at the ground. Vernon lays the now definitely empty weapon on the table. Frank picks it up and weighs it in his hands. He passes i Chris. Chris puts down his briefcase. Martin watches this Frank notices Martin.
A widow-maker.
Shut up.
That’s what...
Shut up.  20.
Hey good to see you. My Mothers people are from Sligo.
That’s nice.
You doing us a Sligo reduction then?

We're doing our bit. I don’t need to be here at all. Frank sucks his teeth. He knows what doing your bit entai And it’s cost him a lot more than Martin would ever be prepared to give up. Chris smells the gun. He looks down the barrel.
You got some rounds?
Sure. Vernon rolls the bullets along the table top. Chris takes rounds and pops them in the magazine.
I’m going to slowly take out my handgun. Is that okay Frank? Frank looks at Chris. Chris nods. Its okay.
Sure. Okay. Ord takes out his pistol and aims it at the ground.
This is just a precaution. While the rifle is live.
You worked with these guys before Ord?
Sure
It’s okay to fire?
Fire away. No one can hear us.  21.
Hey Ord. You ever used your military background to chat up women?
Try not to hit any metalwork. I don’t want to get tagged by a ricochet. Chris gives him a slow sad look. He shoulders the rifle a takes aim.
Military background? Chris looks over at Justine.
Your memories of war... the band of brothers... Blah blah.
No... Who would want to hear that shit? The others step away and put their fingers in their ears.
You more the silent type Ord? Chris squeezes off a round as Ord is about to answer.
Sorry what? Ord goes to talk again.
I hear its all about eye contact
I’m sorry - what?

It’s about eye contact. And caring words. Chris looks at Justine, who is giggling slightly. Chris m a ‘maybe he has a point’ face. Then pulls the trigger. It makes a huge noise in the space. In the distance there a thwack as the bullet hits home. The ejected cartridge h the floor and rolls about. Chris looks back at the others. Then to Frank.  22.
Good.

Okay. Chris squeezes of a few more shots. Refuse bags pop. A lo falls over. There’s a clanging echo in the Warehouse. The echo of the shots dims. Chris then adjusts the Rifle to full auto. He lets off a burst. He then puts on the safety. Takes out the magazine and pu the rack, ejecting a live round. He does this twice more presents it to Vernon. Vernon nods when he sees it’s safe. Chris puts the rifle back on the table. Ord holsters his pistol. Chris takes out a pen and uses it to pick up the brass. He puts them on the table. He looks up at the pill near the table. He walks over to it. Ord watches him.
I thought we had talked about M16‘s?
We did.

The Brits wont even use these things. They fail in the mud. Chris runs his hands over the pillar. There are pock mark it. He looks at Ord. (What Chris is looking at are fresh bullet scars. This place has recently been used as a firi range.)
Well don’t roll about in the mud...
Ord watches Chris looking at Pillar
What is the matter?
What does that look like to you?
Frank frowns and starts negotiating. Justine watches Chri  23.
I’ve got money for M16’s
Well I’ve got AR-18’s - that’s it. Ord looks at the marks

Bullet hits? He shrugs. Not understanding why it might be relevant. Chris looks out to the edges of the warehouse. They would have come from a ways off. Chris looks to Ord then gives on his investigation. He turns to Vernon.
How many?
They all folding stock?
Sure
Well where are they?

Lets see the money chief. Chris pops the case on the table. He opens it up. Martin into his bag and pulls out a money counter. Inside we see 20 round mag for the AR18. He feeds the money into the counter. Justine looks at the money for a moment. They all stand around and stare as he does it.
It’s not that we don’t trust you... it’s just easier this way.
Sure. The money flips through the counter. It comes to an end. Martin looks up.
What would you do if you won the lottery?
I'd buy a cabin back home.
What’s the matter with here?
I like it here, but, it’s just moving through y’know.
Not really...
So you going to do us a reduction on these non M16's?
I’1l do them at 10% off.
12 Chris nods.
Okay. So I take $1200 back?
Sure. I can do you that in ammo if you want.
You were going to charge extra on the ammo?
It’s specialist. You got a press you can do it in your garage or what not? Frank shrugs defeated.

Inside the van sits Gordon: 32. Shoulder length hair. Lea jacket. Harry: 27. Baby faced. Bomber jacket. Harry is picking his knuckles. They are grazed from fighting. Gord watches out of the corner of his eye.
You got the walky turned on?
Yeah, thanks.
We've been here ages. Maybe something has gone wrong.
Sure. They would have squawked. signal.
How long have you worked for Vernon?
Long enough. Your energy is very jumpy. Can you ratchet it down a couple of notches.
Sure. I’m just ready I guess...
To load some boxes?
No... just peeeewwwwww ready. Gordon rolls his eyes.
You need to wash those knuckles you will get an infection.
I was in a fight. The walky squawks.
That’s the sign. 25. The or Gordan starts up the van. John Denver starts up on the 8 track.
You like John Denver?
Sure  26.

In the distance there is the noise of a van starting up. men stand patiently as it approaches. Frank is tense. He looks over to Chris. Chris is not scared but looks on intensely. He strokes his jacket where his gun is. Frank looks to Martin. The van enters the warehouse.
Look, if we wanted to rip you off it would have happened already. Frank looks them up and down for a second. He’s like a ca with a mouse.
How do you all know each other?
Will it make the guns fire any straighter if you knew? Vernon points at Justine.
She vouches for us. That’s how it works. Justine smiles. Thats right.

I don’t want to know you Frank. I’ve got enough friends already. You Don’t want to know me. She brings us all together. Its safer that way. Franks face is set. He’s smiling but he’s not happy. Just detects this. Martins is resolute in not talking.
My father had a gun shop in Sweden. I’ve known the Corsican since I was kid. They know the Corsican, so we are all friends.
That's cozy. You always been into guns Justine?
I grew up with them. How about you?
My Father took me shooting when I was a boy. (MORE )
I’ve always been around them. He was a good shot. Later he was in the Easter uprising. It was a good skill to have.
Story time over?
What war were you in Ord?
Whatever it was, the great Irish army wasn’t involved...

The van rolls in. It comes to a stop. The two men get out They walk around the back of the truck and start unloadin One of the men looks at Stevo. He walks around the van. Martin opens the back door with a key on his key chain. T two men (Gordon and Harry) Start lugging out the boxes. T are about 0.5 ft by 3ft wooden containers with rope handl Martin takes the van keys from Harry and pockets them. Soon there is a pile of boxes. Gordon and Harry are sweat slightly. Harry is eyeing Stevo.
Lets have a look then. Vernon takes a crowbar and opens one of the boxes. Inside three AR18’s in wood chippings. Frank smiles. He points t random box.
What’s your daughter called?
Agneth.
How about that one... Vernon shrugs and opens it. Same deal.
Just open em all. The boxes are opened up. Inside sit the AR18’s Frank purs his lips. Chris leans into Justine. Martin watches neutra
I can’t believe you wont see me tomorrow.  28.
Do you think I’m stupid?
What?
Stop pretending to be interested in my kid.
Just making conversation... Chris looks at the guns. Vernon looks over his shoulder.
They like to run wet. Keep it lubed even when its dirty. He pulls out a can of lube.
On the house... Chris plays with the folding stock.
You got the ammo?

Sure. In the back... But not yet. Chris smiles. Everyone is cautious. Harry takes another look at Stevo as he passes with a box Stevo looks at him with vague recognition. This look turn cold dread over the next few moments. Gordon and Harry br the last box out and put it down. Round the other side of the van Stevo motions to Bernie.
Look who it is... Bernie looks back over his shoulder and spots Harry.
Oh fuck no. Has he made you?

How could he not? Frank makes an inventory of the contents of the boxes. He counts the contents and Chris has a look at a random samp They are all the same - this is the real deal. All new. H is sneaking peaks at Stevo here and there. As each box is signed off, it’s resealed and stacked.  29. A two foot high wooden wall is being built out of packing cases. Gordon looks and sees Harry looking agitated. Round the back of the van he talks to Harry
What’s the matter with you?
I don’t know. I think I know those guys.
Cops?
No.. From last night..
You better get your shit together because we are in a serious situation here... Just chill out. Around the front of the van the deal is coming to a close
Okay. That’s our business almost done here.
You tell the Corsican thanks.
Perfecto. We will leave and then you load out. Give us 5 minutes. You can drive your vehicle round on Lassiter.
Okay. Got it. Harry is staring now. Staring at Stevo. Gordon looks from Harry to Vernon.
Harry...
I know you.
Me?
Shut up Harry.
What’s the problem Gordon?  30. Martin looks at his watch and glances to Justine. She tak small step back. His watch is ticking towards 12.
Yeah.
No you don’t.
Yeah I do. Martin takes a small look to the far pillars.
What’s this about Harry?
This is the guy that hit us last night at Harlequins. Him and his buddy there. Bernie shifts uncomfortably. There is a pause. Frank looks up. Chris looks carefully a Harry.
Is this true?
I don’t know what you are talking about. A moment passes. Vernon stares at Stevo.
You are a terrible liar son.
Come on now. Don’t be calling my brother in-law a liar Stevo is starting to sweat. He looks to Frank. Bernie loo into the middle distance trying to disappear.
Tell them Steven.
I don’t know what he’s talking about. Harry's face is red with anger. As he says the next few l it’s as if he is stepping on an emotional gas peddle. He from straight to ENRAGED in eight words.  31.

Last night there was a fight in Harlequins. Started by this guy and his friends. My cousin, Sally Perigan. She was bottled. She's still in the hospital Frank grimaces. Justine looks to Stevo. She’s not happy a what she is hearing Bernie looks blank. Chris looks at Or Looks at Ord’s hands. Frank talks very slowly and deliberately.
We are here for work. Not to talk about the rights or wrongs of particular bar fights.
I agree. Harry twitches. He is on the rack here. He knows this is wrong place. But his sense of righteousness is eating him alive.
Her face is fucked up... Vernon smiles in a fatherly way.
Well, that’s something you will have to take care of another day.
We can sort this thing out later Harry
He ground the glass into her face.
I wasn’t there. This is bullshit.
Was he all banged up after last night?

I walked into a door. I’ve never been to that bar. Stevo is stepping forward towards Harry. Bernie is natura moving in. Harry is moving forward with Gordon as his win man. It’s coming together. It’s like it wants to happen.
I didn’t start it.. You motherfucker!  32.

You need to stop talking now. Stevo punches Harry. Harry falls back. He scrambles to hi feet and grabs at Stevo. The two men fall to floor in a f of punches and short screams of exertion. Ord looks over to Chris and shrugs.

Christ. Ord and Frank move in and pull the two men apart. They gr them and pries them open. Chris is putting a little distance between himself and th others. Ord and Frank have hold of the flailing men.
YOU FUCKING SHIT. I’LL KILL

I will Harry, but you have to relax. Ord looks to Chris. He can see Harry is about to go. Ther a moment when the fire could catch again just on the vapo Harry wipes his face, he is so conflicted. He’s never bac down in a fight before. Stevo is released by Frank and is wiping blood from his n and gasping for air. Harry looks around at the other men. Chris puts out his h flat and bends down a bit. It’s placatory body language. is talking slowly. The sound has shifted now... It feels muffled. Variously the characters are entering into an endorphin state as their bodies flood with adrenalin.

I’m sorry to hear about your cousin. But we are taking these guns now and leaving. Ord lets go of Harrys’ arm. Chris backs away to give hims a bit of distance. He instinctively knows what’s about to down.
Let’s go Harry.
Okay... that’s okay... Harry goes to walk away. He talks quietly. Defeated.  33.
She was only 17. Stevo watches Harry walk away

Then she shouln’t have been out should she? Chris is watching Harry’s hands. He looks over to Martin. Chris’s hand twitches. He looks back. Harry twists in Martins’ arms pulling a snub-nosed 38. Or sees and pushes forward to get to Harry.

No! Harry fires at Stevo. Time slows. Flare flashes from the muzzle of the snub-nose. Stevo is hit in the shoulder. It opens up in an explosion material and blood. In one action his hand pulls out his M1911 hand-gun from jacket. Stevo falls. Frank looks on in low resignation. This is his fault for bringing the idiot along. Justine looks at Ord. Can he help stop this? Ord catches Justine’s look. It’s out of his hands now. Martin grabs at Harry, trying to stop him. The men all st at each other for a moment. Frank steps backward and gets ready to pull. Chris scans back and forth to see which way this is going go. There is a split second where this fight might not escala But Chris knows as soon as the first shot is fired, the g will come out and there’s no other place to go. Ord takes aim with his automatic. He tracks Harry between crosshairs of this pistol. He pulls the trigger. CLICK  gl. The gun has jammed. Ord puts the safety on and drops the He turns the gun over but nothing drops out. He pulls the rack back and sees that two bullets have jammed in the breach. He tries unblock them but they are totally stuck. He grimaces. Fuck. He starts to strip the gun down.
Harry grasps the handle. He waits a moment then flexes hi muscle to see if he can lift himself from the ground. He grimaces. Its going to be a massive effort.

One, two, three... He pulls himself onto his knee. Then slides up the side o the van door. He sees himself in the wing mirror. Like a ghost. He is standing now. Holding himself up with the do and wedging himself in with his good leg.
Chris falls a couple of stairs. INT. WAREHOUSE BY THE PHONE JUNCTION. Ord is putting the pistol back together. He is almost the He looks up and sees Harry at the van.

Harry licks his lips and digs in his pocket for the van k He retrieves them and slots them in the door lock. He qui turns and hears the door click open. He pushes with his weight to get the door to swing open. He takes the keys out of the door lock and puts them in h pocket. He grabs the briefcase with the money and throws it in th van. Harry shuffles around the open door and crawls up a step toward the cab. He crouches in the well of the door step then forces him self up into the seat. He lays for a mome with his legs dangling out of the van. He looks towards t driving seat and steering wheel.  92. INT. WAREHOUSE BY THE PHONE JUNCTION. Ord finishes putting together his pistol. He takes aim. H pulls the trigger. Nothing. He still has the safety on. H clicks it and takes aim again.

Harry starts to crawl across the two seats in the cab tow the driving seat. As he struggles his feet bash against t door of the van The wind shield shatters as Ord fires at the van. Glass covers Harry. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo is winking in and out of consciousness. He hears Or firing. He sees Harry’s feet sticking out of the van.

Shit... Stevo rolls onto his knees and uses all his strength to b his pistol up and take aim at Harry. He can’t see his bod just his legs. He aims for a minute then stops. The pistol is too heavy. tries to get something to rest his aim on.

Harry wriggles across the seats and grabs the steering wh with his right hand. He pulls himself forward. His feet disappear into the Chevy. The side window shatters as ano bullet hits it. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo realizes that his chance has gone. He drops his pis down for a moment conserving energy. He looks very pale.

Harry gets into the drivers seat and puts his hand in his pocket to get the ignition key. As he pulls his hand out see it is slick with blood. He tries to select the igniti key from the bunch. His hands are slippery and it takes h few attempts to separate the keys. He finally finds the k and puts it in the ignition. He turns it.  93. The engine grinds into life. Harry allows himself a littl smile. He is very weak now. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo leans out from behind the pillar and fires.

The windshield breaks again as Stevo shoots it. Shot low exits the roof of the van. Harry tries to dodge but it’s of a reflex action. Harry puts the van into gear and the deck jumps into life. John Denver’s “Annie’s Song” (this is followed by "It’s Up to You" "Cool an' Green an' Shady" "Eclipse") Harry puts his foot down on the accelerator and lurches forward. A second bullet hits Harry in the chest. He slumps back i his seat and grips the steering wheel. The Chevy is now moving at a snails pace. Harry slumps over the wheel. The Chevy starts to turn toward the South pillar in a lazy wi circle. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo is finding his range now. He takes another shot. Th puts a hole through the side of the Chevy.

Harry is hit and slumps forward. The Chevy rolls on ina circle. INT. WAREHOUSE SOUTH PILLAR. Stevo watches as the van moves slowly around the pillar. a wide arc maybe 1000 metres. He sees Harry inside the va trying to raise his pistol. The van starts to come closer an elliptical circle. Closer and closer. Stevo can hear t music now getting louder as the van get closer.
Harry is holding on for dear life. He rests his gun on th door and fires at Stevo. He misses. The music is very lou the van.  94.
You fill up my senses Come fill me again
Stevo sits against the pillar as the van loops near and t moves away.
Come let me love you Let me give my life to you Let me drown in your laughter Let me die in your arms
Harry is dead, the van keeps going.
Let me lay down beside you Let me always be with you Come let me love you Come love me again
Chris enters the warehouse again. He looks about. It look empty. He sees the van slowly driving around in a circle. ANNIE’S SONG

He moves carefully back towards the South pillar. He has time his movements so he is not run over by the van. He s the dead eyes of Harry as it passes. The music loops nearer and then further away. As it passes Chris moves towards the pillar. INT. SOUTH PILLAR. Chris crawls over to where Stevo is. He gets behind the pillar. There is a lot of blood. He sniffs the air. Stevo dead. He takes his gun and puts it in his pocket. He look over to the AR18 cases. Nothing is moving. Chris sits there for a moment gathering his thoughts. He looks over to the upstairs windows of the offices. He can a red glow of fire.  95. Suddenly water sprinklers turn on.
Fuck it.

Water hits Justine’s face she comes too. She looks up and sees the water pouring over the warehouse. INT. WAREHOUSE. Harry slumps off the stearing wheel and the the Chevy cha direction. It drives towards the far wall and stops. The music still plays. Blood drips from underneath the truck, drip - drip and then stops.
Ord looks up at the water and shakes his head.

LETS SPLIT IT. THIS WAS ALL A

text: Ord slips his pistol in his belt and starts crawling over the distance John Denver is playing “It’s up to you”
Chris watches Ord approach. The water is still pouring. O reaches the pillar and props himself up and looks over to Chris. He looks at Stevo.
He’s gone.
Yeah.
Do you know what the fight at the Harlequin was about?
No. I only met him a few hours ago
Huh. Now that’s funny.
Life is ever at the mercy of idiots. He did alright though. In the end.
Lets get over to the van.
You in a hurry?
I told you. I’ve got shit to do. They both smirk in a resigned way.

Chris and Ord stand up and support each other. They hobbl towards the van. Splashing through the puddles of water t have now formed. They eventually make it to the van.  97. Chris reaches in and turns the music off. John Denver sto singing. Chris takes a breath. He looks at Ord and smiles They might get out of this yet. Suddenly a shot rings out. Ord is hit in the face, the ba of his head exploding across the van panel. He starts to slide backwards. A second shot finds Chris. Chris is hit the chest and slides down the side of the van.
Justine watches as the two men collapse. She watches as t smoke drifts across the warehouse. The fire is taking hol now.
Chris looks up at the water coming out of the sprinkler system. He smiles as it hits his face.

Justine uses the pillar as leverage and manages to get to feet. She slings the rifle under her arm pit and uses it crutch. She hobbles forward. Smoke is blowing across the warehouse now. INT. WAREHOUSE BY THE VAN. Justine approaches. She sees the bodies of Ord and Chris. Chris is still alive. He looks up at Justine. He is diein
I am sorry about you and your friends.
Who were the guys .. The shooters?
Nobody. It was Martin’s idea. But he’s gone now. It was stupid. We were going to get out.. Justine looks sad. She looks over to his body.
I am sorry I shot him. Justine nods. She takes the money out of Chris’s limp han
I am sorry I shot you.  98. Justine puts her sunglasses on and turns to leave. Chris smiles and watches her go. He liked her. Chris talks to himself.

Death is nothing at all Death is nothing at all. I have only slipped away to the next room. I am I and you are you. Whatever we were to each other, That, we still are. Call me by my old familiar name. Speak to me in the easy way which you always used. Put no difference into your tone. Wear no forced air of solemnity or sorrow. Laugh as we always laughed at the little jokes we enjoyed together. Play, smile, think of me. Pray for me. Let my name be ever the household word that it always was. Let it be spoken without effect. Without the trace of a shadow on it.
Justine limps forward. She holds the money. She is determ to survive.

Life means all that it ever meant. It is the same that it ever was. There is absolute unbroken continuity. Why should I be out of mind because I am out of sight? She moves towards the shuttered door exit. Suddenly the roller comes up and she is bathed in light. She shields h eyes. Out of the light steps a fireman. Behind him a fire engine. They run in to fight the fire.
I am but waiting for you. For an interval. Somewhere. Very near. Just around the corner. (MORE )
CHRIS (NARRATION) (CONT’D) All is well. Justine stands there for a moment. She looks back towards camera. ‘This Old Guitar’ By John Denver plays
